channel.title: Tag on Mark Needham
channel.description: Recent content in Tag on Mark Needham

item.title: KSQL: Create stream - extraneous input 'properties'
item.description: Our events are defined as follows: { "id":"ABCDEFGHI", "properties": { "name":"Mark", "location":"London" } } CREATE STREAM users_original( id varchar, properties STRUCT< name varchar, location varchar > ) WITH(KAFKA_TOPIC='users', value_format='json'); When we execute that query we’ll get the following exception: line 3:3: extraneous input 'properties' expecting {'INTEGER', 'DATE', 'TIME', 'TIMESTAMP', 'INTERVAL', 'YEAR', 'MONTH', 'DAY', 'HOUR', 'MINUTE', 'SECOND', 'ZONE', 'PARTITION', 'STRUCT', 'EXPLAIN', 'ANALYZE', 'TYPE', 'SHOW', 'TABLES', 'COLUMNS', 'COLUMN', 'PARTITIONS', 'FUNCTIONS', 'FUNCTION', 'ARRAY', 'MAP', 'SET', 'RESET', 'SESSION', 'IF', IDENTIFIER, DIGIT_IDENTIFIER, QUOTED_IDENTIFIER, BACKQUOTED_IDENTIFIER} Statement: CREATE STREAM users_original( I thought I might have a trailing comma or colon - two mistakes I’ve made before - but on this occassion the problem is that properties is a reserved word in KSQL.
